entities.name: peruvian instant darkness powder
entities.description: A product that causes instant darkness, mentioned as a problem by Ron.

entities.name: fred and george's products
entities.description: The product line of Fred and George Weasley, mentioned as being sold without proper regulation.

entities.name: lumos
entities.description: A spell that produces light, tried by Ginny but ineffective in this case.

entities.name: incendio
entities.description: A spell that produces fire, also tried by Ginny but ineffective in this case.

entities.name: hand thing
entities.description: An object used by Malfoy to see in the darkness.

entities.name: malfoy
entities.description: A Death Eater and a student at Hogwarts, mentioned as guiding others through the dark corridor.

entities.name: death eaters
entities.description: A group of followers of Voldemort, mentioned as being led by Malfoy.

entities.name: ron
entities.description: One of the main characters and a student at Hogwarts, mentioned as having a problem with the darkness powder.

entities.name: ginny
entities.description: One of the main characters and a student at Hogwarts, mentioned as trying to use spells to light up the corridor.

entities.name: neville
entities.description: One of the main characters and a student at Hogwarts, mentioned as running into Lupin and others.

entities.name: lupin
entities.description: A teacher at Hogwarts, mentioned as being informed by Ron, Ginny, and Neville about the problem with the darkness powder.

relationships.description: Fred and George Weasley sold the Peruvian Instant Darkness Powder without proper regulation.
Malfoy used the Hand Thing to see in the darkness.
Ron was affected by the Peruvian Instant Darkness Powder.
Ginny tried to use the Lumos spell to light up the corridor.
Neville told Lupin about the problem with the darkness powder.
Ron and Ginny worked together to try and light up the corridor.
Malfoy led the Death Eaters through the dark corridor.
